contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox academic division |name = Faculty of Health Sciences |former_names = |type = [[Faculty (division)|Faculty]] |affiliation = [[Queen's University]] |parent = |image_name = |image_size = |image_alt = |caption = |established = <!-- {{Start date|YYYY}} --> |closed = <!-- {{End date|YYYY}} --> |city = [[Kingston, Ontario|Kingston]] |province = [[Ontario]] |country = [[Canada]] |coor = |dean = Richard Reznick |academic_staff = |administrative_staff = |students = |undergrad = |postgrad = |doctoral = |alumni = |motto = |motto_lang = |motto_eng = |colours = |symbol = |website = {{URL|http://healthsci.queensu.ca/}} |logo = |footnotes = }} The '''Queen's Faculty of Health Sciences''' is a [[Faculty (division)|faculty]] of [[Queen's University]] in [[Kingston, Ontario|Kingston]], [[Ontario]], [[Canada]]. It contains three schools: the [[Queen's School of Medicine|School of Medicine]], the [[Queen's School of Nursing|School of Nursing]], and the [[Queen's School of Rehabilitation Therapy|School of Rehabilitation Therapy]]. This faculty also administers Queen's University's highly competitive [[Life Sciences]] and [[Biochemistry]] programs. The educational program leading to the [[Doctor of Medicine|MD]] degree is central to the purpose of the faculty. It must meet all the requirements for [[School accreditation|accreditation]] and prepare [[alumnus|graduates]] for postgraduate training leading to licensure and certification by the [[College of Family Physicians Canada]] or the [[Royal College of Physicians and Surgeons of Canada]]. ==External links== *[http://healthsci.queensu.ca/ Queen's Faculty of Health Sciences Website] {{Queen's}} [[Category:Queen's University|Faculty of Health Sciences]]
